intro: Arrowsmithia pulvinaris, commonly known as the purple sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. Its leaves are typically broad and fleshy, adapted to retain water in arid environments. Arrowsmithia pulvinaris is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
